text: Huang Tingjian (Hanzi: 黄庭坚; 1045-1105) was a Chinese calligrapher, painter, and poet from the Song dynasty. He is mainly known as a calligraphy writer. He is one of the four calligraphy masters from the Song Dynasty (Hanzi: 宋四 家).Tingjian believed in Buddhism and also admired Taoism. He fell into the Song Dynasty party combats. Category:Chinese artists Category:Chinese poets Category:11th-century Chinese artists Category:12th-century Chinese artists Category:11th-century Chinese writers
title: Huang Tingjian
